comments.text:
The Add Todo component is the input field and button you see at the bottom of the preview window and where you add new tasks.

When the user types something in the Input Field it is connected to the task_description field of the Create New Record node for the Todo Class. The Record is created when the user clicks the button or when the enter key is hit in the Input Field.

dynamicports.name: inputMappingScript

comments.text:
This is the App component. 

The Header component contains all the logic to update the number of tasks that are left.

The Repeater node is what generates tasks based on what the Query Records node gets back from the backend.

The Add Todo component is the input field and button you see at the bottom of the preview window and where you add new tasks.
Here we are getting all the todos that are in the Todo Class
This is the Header component that displays the logo and how many tasks that are left to do
This Filter Records filters out all the completed tasks so that we only display how many tasks that are left to do. Click this node to see how the filter is set up

Each Todo Item is generated by a Repeater node. We get the data for each item from the Record node that looks at the Todo class in the backend, and this Record node gets it's Id from the Repeater that generates it.
The record node contains the data of a specific row in the backend. Which row is determined by the Record nodes id, and in this app the Repeater node is supplying the Id
Here we update the completed property of this task.
If the user clicks the delete button we delete the Record from the backend
